title: What organic material increases the pH of the soil? - Quora

response.answer_text: Common base-forming cations include calcium (Ca2+), magnesium (Mg2+), potassium (K+) and sodium (Na+). Thus lime/limestone, potash, Epsom salt, wood ash, manure and bone meal will increase the pH of soil.

Organic matter generally decreases the pH of soil due to the effect of humic acids. However, powdered limestone, which is incorganic, is a natural material widely accepted in organic farming, and it can raise soil pH.
